meanings.definition: The quality of having strong moral principles; honesty and decency.
meanings.sent1: Her probities shone through when she returned the lost wallet to its owner.
meanings.sent2: His probities were evident in the way he always stood up for what was right.
meanings.sent3: The probities of the wise old owl were put to the test when he found a bag of treats unattended.
meanings.sent4: In a world full of deceit, her probities were like a beacon of light guiding others.
meanings.sent5: The probities of the knight were so pure that even the darkness dared not approach.

meanings.definition: A person's adherence to the highest principles and ideals.
meanings.sent1: The leader's probities inspired his followers to strive for greatness.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her unwavering probities in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent3: The probities of the superhero led to some comical situations as he always followed the rules.
meanings.sent4: His probities were like a shield, protecting him from the temptations of corruption.
meanings.sent5: The probities of the explorer guided him through uncharted territories with honor.
